metadata.Title: CVE-2015-0557 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Open-source ARJ archiver 3.10.22 does not properly remove leading slashes from paths, which allows remote attackers to conduct absolute path traversal attacks and write to arbitrary files via multiple leading slashes in a path in an ARJ archive.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-0557` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

arj - 3.10.22-13
No subscription required

criterions.comment: arj package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.10.22-13').
